intro: Xerotecoma dardanoi, commonly known as the Dardanian xerophyte, is a rare and specialized plant adapted to arid environments. It belongs to the family Cactaceae and is characterized by its succulent stems and reduced leaves. The plant exhibits a unique form of photosynthesis known as CAM, allowing it to conserve water efficiently. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils with minimal rainfall. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species.
